meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: A Fuel Economy Loophole A report shows a slight increase in the fuel economy of family vehicles for the 2000 model year. But the rise is mostly thanks to a loophole that gives extra mileage credit to cars that can use ethanol.
PAGE C1

Bush Backs Execution Delay For the first time in his five years in office, Gov. George W. Bush of Texas agreed to a 30-day reprieve for a death-row inmate, citing concerns that adequate tests on DNA evidence had not been performed.
PAGE A18

Microsoft Ruling Delayed The federal judge trying the Microsoft antitrust case agreed to delay his final ruling for about a week so the government, which has proposed a breakup, can respond to the company's last filing.
PAGE C2
Spy-Catching Post Rejected The Clinton administration has shelved plans to appoint a special coordinator for government efforts to catch spies.
PAGE A14
Stars Draw Even With Devils Brett Hull scored both goals for Dallas in a 2-1 victory over New Jersey that tied the Stanley Cup final series at 1-1.
SPORTSFRIDAY, PAGE D1
A2 Business Day Real Estate Weather Auto Exchange
